US warns Syria it cannot deceive world over pullout

As Syrian forces pounded opposition strongholds, US officials warned Damascus the world will be watching when a cease-fire begins next week. (AP)

Beckett, Red Sox shelled
by the Tigers, fall to 0-2

Josh Beckett allowed five home runs and failed to get past the fifth inning today as the Red Sox lost to the Tigers 10-0 in Detroit. (AP)

boston college 4, ferris state 1 | pictures

BC wins Frozen Four Championship

Boston College scored once in each of the first two periods and twice in the third to beat Ferris State tonight for the men's hockey program's fifth national championship.
  • Boston College wins NCAA hockey title
  • BC alumni, fans gather to watch hockey title game

Mitt Romney lagging with female voters

Mitt Romney is starting to hone his appeal to women, acutely aware that he must narrow President Obama's lead among this critical constituency. (AP)
  • Santorum to continue campaign in home state of Pa.

Police make arrest in Roxbury shooting

A 19-year-old suspect has been arrested in connection to a shooting last night that left a 46-year-old victim in the hospital with life-threatening injuries. (Globe)
Notable deaths of 2012

Thomas Kinkade dies at 54

Thomas Kinkade, the self-described "Painter of Light" who won success with paintings of idyllic landscapes, cottages and churches, has died.
